title: How to Make Sesame Kale

steps.headline: Prepare the kale by washing it thoroughly.
steps.description: Remove blemishes and any tough parts.

steps.headline: Cut each kale leaf straight down the middle.
steps.description: Then cut crosswise to make slices out of the leaves measuring about 2.5cm (1 inch) each.

steps.headline: Cut the capsicum (bell pepper) into small slices.
steps.description: Do the same for the carrots.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a wok.
steps.description: Once heated, add the garlic and sauté for 10 seconds.

steps.headline: Add the kale strips, capsicum and carrot slices.
Pour in the broth.
steps.description: Cover the wok and steam for 3 minutes (or until the kale wilts).

steps.headline: Pour the soy sauce over the top.
Place the cooked kale onto plates.
steps.description: Top with the toasted sesame seeds and season to taste with black pepper.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: This dish can be served either warm straight from cooking or cold after refrigeration.

text: Prepare the kale by washing it thoroughly. Remove blemishes and any tough parts. Cut each kale leaf straight down the middle. Then cut crosswise to make slices out of the leaves measuring about 2.5cm (1 inch) each. Cut the capsicum (bell pepper) into small slices. Do the same for the carrots. Heat the oil in a wok. Once heated, add the garlic and sauté for 10 seconds. Add the kale strips, capsicum and carrot slices. Stir through quickly. Pour in the broth. Cover the wok and steam for 3 minutes (or until the kale wilts). Pour the soy sauce over the top.  Place the cooked kale onto plates. Top with the toasted sesame seeds and season to taste with black pepper. Serve. This dish can be served either warm straight from cooking or cold after refrigeration. Finished.
